lead_paragraph: Patients at the worst institutions were three times more likely to die and 13 times more likely to have medical complications than at one of the best, a study shows.

headline.print_headline: Hospital Choice May Be a Matter of Life or Death
headline.main: Go to the Wrong Hospital and You’re 3 Times More Likely to Die

snippet: Patients at the worst institutions were three times more likely to die and 13 times more likely to have medical complications than at one of the best, a study shows....
abstract: Study in PLoS One reports patients at worst American hospitals are three times more likely to die and 13 times more likely to have medical complications than if they were treated at one of best facilities; research, led by Boston Consulting Group partner Dr Barry Rosen, focused on medical outcomes of 22 million hospital admissions, and included data from Medicare and private insurers.
